comments.raw_text: We could make header() exit if it's a HEAD request. That seems like it would be a simple solution.
comments.text: We could make header() exit if it's a HEAD request. That seems like it would be a simple solution.

comments.raw_text: Oh wait, except we have to wait for the headers to actually print. So that's a bit more complex. :-) We'd have to make a $cgi->send_header method or something instead of doing a "print $cgi->header".

comments.raw_text: And there are some pages that should be checked, since you may not need to do any processing of the page contents, just whatever would constitute headers.  We've only ever seen HEAD requests coming from MS Office for attachment.cgi locally.
